import React from 'react'; import './App.css'; function App() { return (

Nima Hagh Doust - Lab 10 - React

To do problem 3 of Lab10, I installed Node.js and npm. Using npm, I ran npx create-react-app my-react-app to start the project, and it will install all the required libraries and tools needed to run a simple react application. After navigating to the project folder, I ran npm start to launch the development server.

I modified the App.js code to create this page using simple js and html. I learned that React components use JSX, which is a syntax extension that allows us to write HTML within JavaScript. I also used CSS to style the page to make it look more presentable.

Difficulties Encountered and Solutions:

One challenge I faced was understanding JSX and how JavaScript is embedded within HTML. I solved this by consulting the official React documentation and following online tutorials to get a better understanding. Another issue was handling errors during the initial setup—especially directory issues—which I fixed by making sure I navigated to the correct folders.

); } export default App;
